reviewText: Gameplay is *extremely* minimal, I don't know that there is much of any strategy to it, really.\n\nWish I hadn't bought it...
voteText: 66 of 76 people (87%) found this review helpful 6 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Pros:
Has multiple characters to choose from.
Has many different opponents.
Nice art and music.
And well it never crashed

Cons:
Waaaaaaaaaaay to simplistic.
It looks like you can build several building in the pictures, but it’s all just 1 building (your castle)
You have a map, but to win you have no need to move anywhere. (Just get to level 100)
You have no need to use Builders. (The game will build your castle just fine from random events and leveling)
You have no need to use soldiers, you have no need to ever fight, just run its better for you, even if you win.
You level by gaining population so that is really all you need to do, fighting loses you population so it’s a bad idea.
No level of difficulty it’s all just super easy.

Comments:
When I got to level 38 I was able to jump to 51 the next turn, then to 89 then 100, game over I win (no need to concur any other provinces). This game is in need of play testing and re-balancing.
voteText: 46 of 51 people (90%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
As others have said, there is no challenge to this game.

Click to advance another tedious day.
That's it.
The battles have two strategy options;  either fight or retreat each round.

Dull and boring.
voteText: 32 of 35 people (91%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Gold income needs to be better.
There needs to be another way of winning beside reaching level 100.
This game desperately is in need of a goal to reach because as of right now all you need to do is click start day, end day, and retreat keep doing that and you win. Only reason why I got this game is I wanted to get one of the most craziest and dumb game possible for my 69th game. The trailer was pretty crazy and the game was pretty dumb lol.

I really wanted to give this game a thumbs up but as it is right now I just can't nor can I recommend this for anyone to get.

reviewText:
This is the definition of mobile gameplay, very little decisions to make and lots of grinding.
I undestand the desire for a simple strategy game, but it is not casual, it is much lower than that.
Avoid. It is cleanly done but it is one of the least interesting game on offer for PC.

Gaemplay:
- adjust slider between Ressources, Builders, Warriors and Population increase (no reason to change every turn)
- press enter

occassionaly you get a battle either click autofight or retreat, based on the prediction.
once in a while you get enough gold to purchase an upgrade, but gold come very slowly.

That's all,
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This is game is almost the same as the original Age of Castles (Which I bought in 2006)

The game is very simplistic and easy to win.  No real strategy required, brute forcing the game by spamming days is even enough to win.

I still get some mild enjoyment and satisfaction out of the game but it is quite hollow due to the little effort and how short the game is.

Game takes no more than an hour to complete so definately a long way from the £3.99 price tag, may recommend if it were -90%

reviewText: Bought it for the 2006 nostalgia. Not disappointed, though I can see why other people are easily disappointed.

reviewText: A Kingdom Management Gamehttps://youtu.be/J5qUFCZPm4M\nThis game is pretty basic, as in your main role is to reallocate your population between 4 categories of jobs, and while you wait for your population to grow you will be attacked by various creature armies" and you can either fight and get a small reward if you win or run away
date: and you end up buying upgrades with the gold you earn.\n\n+ Srategy elements
recommended:
decided were you want your population to focus their efforts is pretty key in determining how fast you will grow or how well prepared you will be for a fight.
+ Unique battle system where you will always take a loss in population which makes every fight feel like it may not be worth it.
+ Easy to learn and play

- Not a whole lot of gameplay or player influence
hoursPlayed: you mainly watch what happens and occasionally decide to retreat
helpfulPercent:
or buy some upgrades.
- Somewhat difficult to understand what was happening at first.
- A lot of social media links and ads


As a fair warning I'd just like to note this game is NOT for everyone
votesHelpful: and is very different from anything I've seen on Steam as it relies less on gameplay and more on making a few choices every so often."

reviewText:
I am so excited to write this review.
Let me tell you where this game shines.
The fricken Arnold Swartzenager commercial advertisement for this game.
I got full-on wood for this game when I saw it.
I dont care that it has 4 negative reviews.
4 negative reviews is about absolutely nothing.
As far as I am conscerned there is no game on steam that has less then 4 negative reviews so thats saying somthing.
I was also able to download this game in under 30 seconds. I am STOKED.
10 stars out of 5,       BUY     THIS      GAME.

reviewText:
Very simple time waster.  If you concentrate on building population and retreating from all conflicts without putting any resources into your army you should be fine.

If you try other approaches it might make the game play more difficult.

Giving it an up vote out of courtesy to developer only.  I noticed this game is free from other sources.
